image.altText: A long queue of people stand in line with their luggage at Perth Airport.

props.synopsis: A refuelling issue at Perth Airport which had grounded dozens of domestic and international flights is resolved, but many passengers are unhappy.

title.children: Passengers vent fury after Perth Airport flight cancellations leave them without refunds

image.altText: A young blonde woman named Ariel Bombara sitting while being interviewed.

props.synopsis: A system designed to keep women safe seemingly follows all the right procedures and somehow two women are shot dead in their own home. What needs to change to fix it?

title.children: Two Perth women slain in their own home, yet police say all correct procedures were followed. How do we fix this?

image.altText: the rubble after a house explosion in whalan western sydney on 010624

props.synopsis: A delicate search and rescue operation is under way in Western Sydney for a woman feared trapped beneath rubble after an explosion destroyed a townhouse in a complex this afternoon.

title.children: Woman feared trapped underneath rubble after explosion destroys home in Sydney's west

image.altText: Max Holmes jumps towards the ball as Liam Baker watches on

props.synopsis: Geelong and Richmond are locked in a tight contest at Kardinia Park, while Harley Reid may come under the AFL match review officer's microscope following an incident in West Coast's defeat to St Kilda. Follow live.

title.children: Cats and Tigers set for tense grandstand finish, Harley Reid facing potential suspension

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: 3QT: Cats take slender lead into final term
HT: Tigers still on top but Cats show fight
QT: Tigers dominate Cats to hold 13-point lead

image.altText: View of a mountainous peak.

props.synopsis: Search teams looking for a walker missing since Wednesday in the remote Tasmanian wilderness say they have located a body and it appears the man has fallen to his death.

title.children: Hiker dies during solo trek in Tasmanian wilderness

image.altText: A mock up of the live nation and ticketmaster logos on a phone

props.synopsis: According to Ticketmaster's public filing, the company first identified "unauthorised activity" on May 20, a week before the post on social media.

title.children: Ticketmaster confirms data breach days after Home Affairs launches investigation

image.altText: A white man with short brown hair and glasses sitting in an office. He's wearing a shirt and tie

props.synopsis: Julian Hill is one of a number of MPs calling for a complete ban on the use of genetic tests in life insurance assessments.

title.children: An MP's daughter nearly died from a common genetic condition. When he went to get tested, the doctor's response shocked him

image.altText: Two men walk across a Melbourne CBD bridge with a COVID vaccination poster in view

props.synopsis: The state government will be forced to publicly release thousands of pages of secret briefings behind the state's lockdowns, following an almost four-year Freedom of Information battle.

title.children: Victorian government forced to release documents behind lockdown decisions

image.altText: A red and green gradient lights up the night sky.

props.synopsis: May saw Perth stunned by acts of chilling violence that sent shock waves far beyond the city. But there were also moments of quiet beauty in WA, and our photographers were on hand to capture it all.

title.children: From glowing night skies and scenes of immense courage, these are WA's best photos of the month

image.altText: Hawks coach Sam Mitchell during the round 12 match against the Crows.

props.synopsis: Hawthorn coach Sam Mitchell blasts a racist social media post directed at one of his players, saying if it came from a Hawks fan they are unwelcome at the AFL club.

title.children: 'We don't want you': Sam Mitchell decries racism after social media abuse of Hawks player

image.altText: Keith Davis stands outside the Royal Adelaide Hospital.

props.synopsis: Keith Davis and Kerry Jordan — who were injured onboard a Singapore Airlines flight from London to Singapore that encountered severe turbulence — have returned home to Adelaide via a medical evacuation flight.

title.children: 'Tough days ahead' says Australian couple injured on Singapore Airlines flight, as they return home to Adelaide

image.altText: two women sit on an outdoor couch

props.synopsis: One photographer looks at three households embracing communal living to see if Australians can adapt their way of life as housing becomes ever more unaffordable.

title.children: Moving back home, co-housing, and boarders. How three households embraced communal living

image.altText: a photo collage of a young indigenous man

props.synopsis: As the coroner tries to get to the bottom of what happened to the 27-year-old, the case remains short on strong evidence while abundant with theories and claims of criminal conduct.

title.children: Guns, drugs and a 'feast' of lies: Straight answers difficult to find for missing man's devastated family

image.altText: Trump looks down frowning while wearing a suit in court

props.synopsis: Donald Trump has been found guilty in a hush money trial, but his legal woes are far from over. As he continues his bid to retake the White House, here’s a status update on his other court cases.

title.children: Your guide to Donald Trump's other criminal court cases following his guilty verdict

image.altText: Dozens of hens with glossy brown feathers and red plump combs under a clear blue sky.

props.synopsis: With Australian officials closely monitoring local outbreaks of avian influenza, and another highly pathogenic strain wreaking havoc overseas, experts in infectious disease and public health say this is how we should prepare for the possibility of a future pandemic.

title.children: As avian flu spreads around the world, experts say 'we're nowhere near prepared' for a future pandemic

image.altText: Robert Picketon

props.synopsis: The Correctional Service of Canada said in statement that Pickton, an inmate of Port-Cartier Institution in the province of Quebec, died in hospital following injuries in the May 19 assault.

title.children: Canadian serial killer Robert Pickton dies after prison assault aged 74

image.altText: A sliced apple showing its orange flesh and a bright red apple

props.synopsis: A rosy-skinned, red-fleshed apple named Kissabel is one of several new styles set to tempt fruit lovers back to eating an apple a day to revive the fruit's market share.

title.children: From red flesh to star-like spots, apples sold in Australia are about to look different

image.altText: A girl sits on the ground in a dry paddock in front of a large tractor covered in wool.

props.synopsis: Tina Stefanou and the Carnamah community spent nine days sewing the outfit for the John Deere tractor, which formed the centrepiece of an interactive artwork in the farming town.

title.children: Tractor is dressed in sheep's clothing as intersection of agriculture and art probed in WA

image.altText: A man holding a bike standing next to an illuminated tent. Above him, the milkyway stretches exapnsively.

props.synopsis: How would you like to pack all your camping gear and clothes into a few bags, strap them onto a bike and go camping? Meet the people who can't think of anything better.

title.children: Bikepacking is booming around Australia. But what's the attraction of two wheels and a tent?

image.altText: A group of males and females warming up on the road before they exercise

props.synopsis: When it's cold and dark, there's nothing less appealing than hitting the gym for a workout. Here's how to stay motivated to exercise when the temperature drops.

title.children: Don't let the cold weather stop you from exercising. Here's how to stay motivated in winter

image.altText: Joe Biden stands behind a lectern speaking with his hand and index finger in the air while making a point

props.synopsis: The three-stage proposal includes a permanent ceasefire and the return of Israeli hostages in exchange for Palestinian prisoners.

title.children: 'We can't lose this moment': Biden urges Hamas to accept latest ceasefire proposal from Israel to end war

image.altText: On a man's upper arm, a black and white tattoo of Trump's face can be seen.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's conviction in the hush money trial in New York gives him another line to help push the conspiracy theory he's been promoting to his supporters all along.

title.children: I've been talking to Trump's 'super supporters' for years. This is why they see his conviction as injustice

image.altText: a graphic showing a male middle-aged police officer, a young man in a white collared shirt and a woman wearing a dress

props.synopsis: The coronial inquest into the death of Kumanjayi Walker has finished after almost two years of hearings, leaving the Northern Territory Police Force in crisis.

title.children: How a coroner's inquiry into a police shooting uncovered a culture of racism in the ranks

image.altText: Andrew Giles arrives for QT

props.synopsis: Amid the "direction 99" controversy, the importance of adequate investment in institutions in order to meet the needs of Australians is once again coming to a head.

title.children: The cutting of public service 'fat cats' is popular, until it results in a bureaucracy run into the ground

image.altText: An AI generated image of tents forming letters reading All Eyes on Rafah

props.synopsis: An AI-generated image with the words "All eyes on Rafah" has ricocheted across social media, attracting million of shares. So how did a picture that's not even real become a defining image of the Israel-Gaza war? And has it made any difference?

title.children: Bella Hadid and Nicola Coughlan have shared this defining image of the Israel-Gaza war but it's not even real

image.altText: A profile of a young man smiling

props.synopsis: Jonathan Bolwell's life is back on track thanks to a regional rehabilitation facility. Now there are calls for more rehab centres across regional WA, which has the highest average meth consumption rate in Australia.

title.children: Jonathan was hooked on meth in 'seconds', but now he's helping others reclaim their lives

image.altText: A NASAMS AMRAAM missile is launched from a High Mobility Launcher.

props.synopsis: Senior executives working for a large US-owned defence company helping to establish a missile production enterprise in Australia have resigned amid tensions with the Albanese government over the multi-billion-dollar project.

title.children: Leadership overhaul at Raytheon Australia amid tensions with government over massive weapons project

image.altText: a man climbs over other politicians

props.synopsis: Taiwan's parliament has been thrown into chaos in recent weeks, with brawling on the floor of the chamber and huge citizen protests outside. Here's why.

title.children: 'No discussion, no democracy': Why Taiwan's new parliamentary reforms are leading to scenes like this

image.altText: Donald Trump speaks at a press conference with american flags behind him.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump confirms he will appeal against his conviction for falsifying business records, as President Joe Biden criticises his "dangerous" claim the trial was rigged.

title.children: As Trump vows to appeal conviction, poll gives snapshot of Republicans' reactions

image.altText: Narendra Modi waves his hand as he stands on a staircase wearing a white vest.

props.synopsis: Narendra Modi is widely believed to be on the verge of winning his third consecutive general election, but voters in his constituency say other issues are on their minds in the lead up to the vote.

title.children: 'No Modi wave this time': Is Narendra Modi losing his sheen in his own seat?

image.altText: The black and white film is orange in tinge, and shows multiple frame of a boy eating an apple

props.synopsis: More than 10,000 reels of delicate film, including some of Australia's oldest movies, are packed to the rafters of the National Film and Sound Archive's Canberra storage facility.

title.children: Australia's most fragile and flammable film treasures get a budget boost

image.altText: Bunch of white, oval medication tablets and white medication capsules.

props.synopsis: Many menopause drugs on the market derive from estrogen from pregnant horses. Now, a women's health expert and integrative doctor is calling for a shake-up of the government-subsidised PBS list to include newer medicines with fewer side effects.

title.children: 'Reversible illness' forcing women out of workforce leads doctor to call for menopause drug reform

image.altText: An illustration of a woman reading a book in the bath.

props.synopsis: From the next novel by the 2023 Miles Franklin winner to a First Nations version of Shakespeare, to the hotly anticipated follow-up to Brooklyn, there are plenty of great new books to read this month.

title.children: The six books our critics couldn't put down this month
